caption.paragraph:
Fig. 18.
Mexico masamii ( Satô, 1994 )
, male (A–F) and female (G–J) genitalia (EUMJ). A, G . Sternite VII. B . Sternite VIII. C . Sternite IX. D . Aedeagus, ventral view. E . Aedeagus in dorsal view. F . Aedeagus in right lateral view. H . Urosternite. I . Ovipositor.

subSubSection.paragraph: Body ( Fig. 19 ) about 1.5 mm , cream-colored, bearing long setae on head, pronotum, elytra and abdomen.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 19. Pupa of
Mexico masamii ( Satô, 1994 )
. A . Ventral aspect. B . Dorsal aspect. Scale bar: 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Japan (Honshu, Sadogashima, Izu Islands (Shikine-jima, Kozu-shima), Shikoku, Kyushu, the Ryukyus (Yakushima, Amami-Ôshima, Tokuno-shima, Okinoerabu-jima, Yoron-tô, Okinawa-jima, Irabu-jima, Kume-jima, Miyako-jima, Ishigaki-jima)).

This species has the northernmost distribution (Sado Island) in the subfamily
Thaumastodinae ( Kamezawa 2017 )
.
